result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Brian R Olson

records.addlTxt:
Final status/scheduling conference on February 14, 2023 at 03:30 pm.
Jury trial on February 20, 2023 at 08:45 am.

[ma] Case called at 10:49 AM 
Defendant Brian R Olson appeared by zoom from the Rock County Jail, in custody.  Attorney Jeffrey Jacob De La Rosa in court for Brian R Olson.  Attorney Brookellen Teuber in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Atty De La Rosa indicates that resolution has not been reached.

Statement made by Victim.

Statement made by Defendant. 
recess: 10:57am 
NEXT:  (1)FSSC on 2/14/23 at 3:30pm (2)Jury Trial on 2/20/23 at 8:45am
Status conference on October 27, 2022 at 10:30 am.

[MK] case called at 11:23am 
Defendant Brian R Olson not in court. Attorney Jeffrey Jacob De La Rosa in court. ADA Theresa Beck in court for the State of Wisconsin.  
Attorney De La Rosa indicates that Mr. Olson is currently incarcerated in the Rock County Jail. He proposed scheduling further out so that more becomes known regarding the Rock County matter.
recess 11:25am

NEXT:  (1) clerk- add Rock County Jail to the mailing matrix, Mr. Olson is currently incarcerated there on a high cash bail-requirement,  (2) Status Conference on October 27th at 10:30am with arrangements to be made for Mr. Olson to appear by videoconference
Status conference on September 23, 2022 at 10:30 am.

[MK] case called at 11:36am 
Defendant Brian R Olson not in court.  Attorney Jeffrey De La Rosa in court. DA Monica Hall in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
DA Hall verifies rights compliance.
This case is scheduled for Status Conference.  Attorney De La Rosa indicates that Mr. Olson has been in contact with him; he is not able to appear due to being ill. Mr. Olson has provided Attorney De La Rosa with test result information that confirms the illness.
The Court excuses the non-appearance 
recess 11:35am

NEXT:  Status Conference on September 23rd at 10:30am

Pre-trial conference on August 17, 2022 at 10:40 am.
Status conference on September 1, 2022 at 11:00 am.

[ma] Caes called at 9:10 AM 
Defendant Brian R Olson in court with Attorney Jeffrey Jacob De La Rosa.  Michael C. Witt appears for the State of Wisconsin.
ADA Witt verifies victim rights compliance--notes Victim 1 and 2 are present.

Mr. Olson waives his right to Preliminary Hearing; the Court accepts this waiver and binds him over for Trial.

Arraignment:
--service of Information admitted, reading waived
--the charges and maximum penalties are recited
--pleas of "not guilty" entered
--in response to the Court's inquiry, both counsel indicate that they are not requesting speedy trial.
recess: 9:15am 

NEXT:   (1) Pretrial Conference on 8/17/22 at 10:40am    (2) Status Conference on 9/1/22 at 11:00am

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Preliminary hearing on July 15, 2022 at 09:00 am.

[ae] case called 11:00 AM Defendant Brian R Olson in court. ADA Michaels appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
The Defendant verifies that the address and date of birth listed on the Criminal Complaint are correct. 
Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, the charges and maximum penalties are recited
Right to counsel is given.  
Preliminary Hearing time limits are waived by both parties.
The Court finds probable cause to exist in the Criminal Complaint.

The Court requires $5,000 Signature Bond, with conditions:
--no contact with any of the Victims 1, 2, 3, 4 with the exception of in court proceedings and any payments made by mail in accordance with any civil judgments
--not to be allowed to accept any down-payments for contractual work
--Defendant is to report to the Jefferson County Sheriff's Office for booking (fingerprints and photographs)

recess 11:06 am
NEXT: (1) Preliminary Hearing on 7/15/22 at 9:00 am
Proposed Order to Seal Victim Key
